Think, Pair, Share

Think: Open your Learning Journal and find the design solution sketches and notes and the most recent engineering journal. Take a minute or two to look over your sketches, notes, and engineering journal before talking with your partner.

Pair & Share: With a partner, discuss the two questions below. Explain your answers by showing your partner your sketches, notes, and engineering journal.

  1. What aspects of idea generation were interesting or enjoyable? Why?
  2. What aspects of idea generation were more challenging? Why?

Today's Class: Idea Generation (Part 2)

In today's lesson you will continue idea generation by thinking of new and different ideas for water conservation design solutions.

Remember that the purpose of idea generation activities is to help you come up with new ideas for design solutions. You don't have to draw well. You don't have to like all your ideas. The important thing is to think of new ideas and sketch them.
